snippet.title: 'Bioshock Infinite' postponed until 2013
snippet.description:
* What was arguably the most anticipated video game of 2012 just became one of the most anticipated games for 2013.
http://www.cnn.com/2012/05/09/tech/gaming-gadgets/bioshock-infinite/index.html

snippet.title: Meet Elizabeth: The heart and soul of 'BioShock Infinite'
snippet.description:
* When the highly anticipated "BioShock: Infinite" hits stores on Tuesday, a naive 19-year-old with special powers and book smarts -- but little true grasp of the complexities of the world around her -- will meet a gaming public that's been awaiting her debut for years.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/03/25/tech/gaming-gadgets/bioshock-infinite-elizabeth/index.html

snippet.title: Emotions are real, universe endless in 'BioShock Infinite'
snippet.description:
* The goal of "BioShock Infinite," creative director Ken Levine said, was to have "moved the ball down the field" in terms of how video games can be vehicles for telling engrossing, expansive stories.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/03/26/tech/gaming-gadgets/bioshock-infinite-review/index.html

snippet.title: 'The Killing' final season gets Netflix release date
snippet.description:
* The final season ? the real final season this time ? of "The Killing" has a release date.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/24/showbiz/tv/the-killing-netflix-release-ew/index.html

snippet.title: 'BioShock Infinite' moves adventures to the sky
snippet.description:
* Hoping to continue the success of its BioShock franchise, 2K Games announced that "BioShock Infinite" will be produced by the team that created the game's original title.
http://www.cnn.com/2010/TECH/gaming.gadgets/08/13/bioshock.infinite/index.html

snippet.title: Complaint: School stabbing suspect said, 'I have more people to kill'
snippet.description:
* A teenager tackled by a vice principal refused to drop the knives he'd used to stab 21 at his Pittsburgh-area high school, saying, "My work is not done, I have more people to kill," according to a criminal complaint released Friday.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/25/justice/pennsylvania-school-stabbing/index.html

snippet.title: Nintendo's Wii U coming in November
snippet.description:
* Nintendo announced a November release date for its next-generation Wii U on Thursday while looking to shore up two key constituencies -- those still puzzling over the console's "second screen" controller and hardcore gamers who still view the Wii as geared toward families and kids.
http://www.cnn.com/2012/09/13/tech/gaming-gadgets/nintendo-wii-u-event/index.html

snippet.title: 'Scandal' actor Columbus Short leaving show
snippet.description:
* Days after Columbus Short's wife publicly alleged he threatened to kill her and himself with a knife, the actor on the hit ABC TV series "Scandal" has called it quits.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/25/showbiz/scandal-actor-columbus-short-leaves-show/index.html

snippet.title: Measles cases at highest level in nearly 20 years, CDC reports
snippet.description:
* More people have been infected with measles in the United States during the first four months of this year than have been infected in the first four months of the past 18 years, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/24/health/measles-record-number/index.html

snippet.title: Richard Gere and Padma Lakshmi: Why it makes sense
snippet.description:
* While the reported romance between movie star Richard Gere and "Top Chef" host Padma Lakshmi might leave some scratching their heads, we totally get it. Let's start with the fact that they are both gorgeous and legends in their own fields. Gere has...
http://marquee.blogs.cnn.com/2014/04/23/richard-gere-and-padma-lakshmi-why-it-makes-sense/
